alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Monmouth; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 3:20PM EDT until September 08 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR EASTERN MERCER...SOUTH CENTRAL SOMERSET...SOUTHWESTERN MONMOUTH AND SOUTHWESTERN MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 319 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hightstown, or 13 miles east of Trenton, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Princeton, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Cranbury, Allentown, Roosevelt, Rocky Hill, Princeton Meadows, Windsor, Kingston, Dayton, Plainsboro Center, Clearbrook Park, Edinburg, Twin Rivers, Whittingham and Kendall Park. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8 and 9. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 5 and 14. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
